result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C Segermark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay Court Costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
______________________________
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
__________________________________

*TIME SERVED*
WITH HUBER PRIVELEGES. IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott C Segermark in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 2:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for evidentiary hearing. Defendant is challenging the Doctor's report of non-competency.
2:06 p.m. - Attorney Raff makes a record that the defendant now agrees with the Doctor's Report and believes he is not competent to stand trial at this time. Court makes a record and finds defendant is not competent to stand trial at this time. Defendant is staying at an outpatient facility at this time. Court signs order of commitment and sets status hearing in three (3) months. Court in recess @ 2:12 p.m. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott C Segermark in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Francis P Raff appeared.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Francis Raff
Defendant Demand

Defendant Scott C Segermark in court, in custody with attorney Francis P Raff.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty Raff denied. Bond Remains. Not guilty plea entered. Trial demanded by defendant.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.S. OR HER RESIDENCE. MUST COMPLY WITH RESTRAINING ORDER. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
